subject: Released: Concordion 1.1.0 (similar to the Fit Framework for acceptance testing)
msgSnippet: I ve released a new version of the Concordion acceptance testing framework to support JUnit 4.4. Example: HTML:
messageBody:
I've released a new version of the Concordion acceptance testing
framework to support JUnit 4.4. Example:

HTML:

<html xmlns:concordion="http://www.concordion.org/2007/concordion">
<body>
<p>
The greeting for user
<span concordion:set="#firstName">Bob</span>
will be:
<span
concordion:assertEquals="greetingFor(#firstName)">Hello Bob!</span>
</p>
</body>
</html>


JUnit 4.4:

import org.concordion.integration.junit4.ConcordionRunner;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;

@RunWith(ConcordionRunner.class)
public class Demo {

public String greetingFor(String firstName) {
return String.format("Hello %s!", firstName);
}
}


See: http://www.concordion.org <http://www.concordion.org>

David

---
David Peterson
http://blog.davidpeterson.co.uk <http://blog.davidpeterson.co.uk>
